instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
no water damage.
20v 0.5a without battery. 20v 2a with battery.
fan spin for 2-3 sec and stop
Main S5, S4 and S0 rails are present.
PPVCCCPU_S0G - 0.9 at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 0.9v and stay stable.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 3.3v  at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 3.3v and stay stable.
PLT_RST_L -3.3v at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 3.3v and stay stable.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
Did you try the board alone on the desk?
Check for USB activity.

Worth to try known good BIOS...

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69545, member: 682"]

[/QUOTE]
yes of course, the same.

there is USB activity.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69545, member: 682"]
Worth to try known good BIOS...
[/QUOTE]
HOW?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
USB activity for sure?
Did you see flashing Link LED on USB boot pendrive?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message: yes..i have ssd adapter with blue and red light its work and act like the other....turn on for 3sec then turn of for 2-3sec and then turn on again and stay

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message: When the board stays on again, Link LED keeps flashing???

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message: just stay on...CAPS LOCK light not turn on

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
So NO USB activity in fact.
The board turns/stays on, but doesn't boot.

Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69573, member: 682"]
Try known good BIOS.
[/QUOTE]
how i check/try?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
Reflash the SPI chip U6100.
If you don't have Medusa programmer, remove the chip and use classic USB programmer.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message: o.k i have medusa 2 i was read mac rom from good working (same board) and write on this mac(hope this is the right thing)...but act the same

threads.title: A1708 820-00840 - Not powering on
threads.message:
I hope you've cleaned ME region too.
However board should boot even with dirty ME, if BIOS works in other board.

Probably bad CPU there...
